subject: Ethics
title: Creative AI and Artist Rights
description: A fast breakdown of Creative AI and Artist Rights for builders.

hook.text: An AI won a state art competition. The artist typed a text prompt. Real painters spent months on theirs.

buildup.text: AI image generators train on billions of artworks scraped from the internetâ€”often without artists' consent.

discovery.text: These tools can produce art 'in the style of' any living artist in seconds, undercutting their livelihood.

twist.text: Artists sued, but copyright law never anticipated machines that learn style. Legal frameworks are decades behind.

climax.text: The question isn't whether AI can create art. It's whether it should profit from stolen training data.

punchline.text: The machine learned from artists. The artists learned nothing back.

quiz.question: What is the core ethical issue with AI art generators?
options: AI art is always lower quality than human art
They train on artists' work without consent and undercut their livelihoods
Artists refuse to use any digital tools
